column5: I went to pick up an impeller for my little kicker today at Sandy Cove Marine and Everything (except for boats) is on sale for 40% off. They are in receivership.  Still lots of sweet stuff there.  Definately worth a trip or phone call if you need a prop as they have hundreds.  New props and hubs for under $100. If anyone was looking for a new fishfinder they had one 596c hd di left.  Reg price there is 699 so you can get it for about $413.  I know the regular price was a bit high but that unit at bps in the states is still $550.  Sad times for the Sandy Cove.  Maybe it was just too big.  Anyway, If you need a tube or a decent wakeboard you can get some pretty good deals.
Thanks Cudz!  Do the sell life vests?
Do you know if that applies to Sandy cove North, here in North Bay?
I heard last night that they are going out of business also.
Worth a trip to Barrie. It's too bad to see that happen but I guess those that go shopping there will score some great deals on stuff.
That too bad.I bought my boat there in 2002 and have been buying all my maintenance supplies from them . Convenient and they always had what I needed.
Yes they had a bunch but only one auto inflate left and it was a mustang belt.
thx Cudz !! any fishfinder in ~ 300 range.
Update... the one in north Bay has the same deal on. A buddy of mine went up and dropped $600+ on a bunch of stuff. Winch, life jackets, helmets, snowmobile belts etc...

Nice to see folks getting a good finally at Sandy Cove, I priced a boat there one time and almost fainted when the guy gave me the price. When I asked him if he was serious he said we are Sandy Cove we don't discount, I said okay and spent 20k down the road.
